WRITING.TEXT: When you load the game into Dolphin VR it gives you game specific preferences... This newest version has the AR codes already loaded in and you can select them. One of them is the 60 fps hack and the other is the 60 fps jump fix. Those are the only two I'm using, plus I selected all the "Hide Box" options that clear up the UI.
I couldn't find any object removal codes for it. They weren't on /r/dolphinvrcullin. Do you know of another place to find them?

WRITING.TITLE: Ocarina of Time on Dolphin VR satisfying as hell
WRITING.TEXT:
I loaded up the Gamecube version of Ocarina of Time, my favorite game, to Dolphin VR, and I couldn't have been more delighted by the result. Some work definitely still needs to be done on the emulation (such as hiding the 16:9 widescreen black box), but with the 60 fps hack going it was the best I've ever seen it and I was completely immersed in the world. Seeing the artwork up close and being towered over by the Deku Tree was an experience that I never thought I'd have. I truly could not believe what I was looking at all through the opening sequence. Last night I played up through Gohma boss fight completely awestruck. Unfortunately, I was getting quite sick feeling by the end of it, though.
So I'll probably take another stab at it today because it was just too much fun. This and Xenoblade Chronicles shocked the shit out of me at how well they run in VR.

WRITING.TITLE: Waited months, now I'm waiting on eye strain to go away.
WRITING.TEXT:
And yes, I feel like a fool. Played for several hours two days ago and felt like I was going cross eyed. I had my ipd set at 61 which looked the clearest, but after realizing something had to be wrong I found 66 to be the clearest. But the (temporary) damage was already done. I still feel like my eyes need more rest two days later, although I feel somewhat better. I measured my ipd using a ruler today and got 67.
So, tl;dr: make sure to get your ipd right before diving in for the first time.
I'm going to sit out however many days it takes to feel completely normal.
Nope, BlazeRush, Lucky's Tale, and a ton of stuff on Virtual Desktop so far.

Hm... I hadn't thought about eyes vs turning. IPD is what I was thinking was the problem but I'm sure 66 is the clearest for me. Maybe I had already stressed my eyes out before I found the right setting.

WRITING.TITLE: Eye fatigue surprised me on Day 1. What am I doing wrong?
WRITING.TEXT:
Hi /r/Oculus. I got my Rift yesterday, played all day, and today I'm still feeling fatigued in my eyes/brain. After messing with the settings several times throughout the session, I am pretty sure I have it aligned for the clearest picture. Yet no matter what I do I feel like I'm going slightly cross-eyed right when I put on the headset.
This didn't stop me from having fun, although it is concerning. Now I'd love to jump back in, but I still feel some leftover eye strain from last night. I was taking turns with a friend who didn't feel anything like what I've described.
Anyone else run into this issue?

What I'm planning to do with the sensor bar is leave the one I already have plugged into my Wii and it should do the job for Dolphin as well. Being plugged in gives it power to send the infrared light so it doesn't matter what it is plugged in to. Otherwise people have said simple solutions like a lit candle will work, but I've never tried it.
And I'd imagine your HOTAS could be connected and configured like a gamepad within Dolphin.

WRITING.TITLE: Wii Sports on Dolphin VR?
WRITING.TEXT: Really curious if this could work well. With the Wii remote it might feel like the Vive. Wii Sports Resort might even be the better candidate. I'm thinking these games and the rare few others with well done motion controls like Skyward Sword, Goldeneye, and Red Steel should be a priority for the emulation community.

8:09 am, Southern California just got charged and got the processing email. My estimate had been April 25 - May 5. My order time seems to be an outlier based on the 8:06 numbers everyone keeps posting. I'm thinking it's because I live so close to Oculus HQ.
Finishing up Stardew Valley with Dark Souls 3 waiting to go.

WRITING.TITLE: The Masters will be broadcast in virtual reality, only on GearVR
WRITING.TEXT: Sad news that we can't try out our sweet CV1's with this weekend's Masters tournament. NextVR is the app GearVR users can download from Oculus Home to watch the telecast. I hope this doesn't set a precedent that excludes sports from their flagship HMD. Any chance it's possible to get NextVR running on the Rift?

WRITING.TITLE: How badass is EVE: Valkyrie?
WRITING.TEXT: Title. I want you to tell me this is a system seller.

WRITING.TITLE: EVE: Valkyrie impressions?
WRITING.TEXT:
After being completely blown away by it in 5 minutes at E3, EVE: Valkyrie is why I'm hyped. When I took off the headset, I was astonished to be back in the real world, and I haven't been satisfied with regular gaming since.
So, those of you with a Rift on launch day, how is the overall gameplay? After reading Oculus Rift hardware reviews today, I feel like they'd be more stoked about the launch if they weren't slogging through Gear VR ports and focusing their time on potential aces like Eve.
I tried Eve Valkyrie at E3 this year and was completely astonished. From then til now I have been dying to get back in.

WRITING.TITLE: Most successful "streaks" in history?
WRITING.TEXT: For instance The Beatles incredible run of 12 #1 albums in 7 years. Or Tiger Woods going over a decade winning every major he led at the start of the final day. Or streaks to do with war, science, politics, etc.
Hmm alright I will keep an eye on Amazon. Thanks for the tip.
Thanks for taking the time to comment. I'll go with a WD then. The reason I'm building a PC at all is because I preordered the Rift.

WRITING.TITLE: [Build Help] 5820k, 980ti build - Which motherboard, cooler, power supply, storage?
WRITING.TEXT:
I've got my heart set on the 5820k cpu, EVGA 980ti gpu, and the 500 gig 850 EVO SSD, but that's all I know for sure. I've heard the X99 class of motherboards are what I need, but which one is best? There's is some conflict on PCPartPicker - It says, " The motherboard M.2 slot #0 shares bandwidth with SATA 6.0 Gb/s ports. When the M.2 slot is populated, two SATA 6Gb/s ports are disabled."
As far as cooling, would love to get a clear answer on what is best for this setup which I will most likely overclock at some point in the future. Same goes for the power supply.
Finally, in addition to the SSD I was considering a 2 or 3 TB HDD.
Thank you for reading.
[PCPartPicker part list](http://pcpartpicker.com/p/b8BDBm) / [Price breakdown by merchant](http://pcpartpicker.com/p/b8BDBm/by_merchant/)

The more details the better.** Oculus Rift and 1080p max overkill gaming.
**What is your budget (ballpark is okay)?**
$2000

Thanks, I'll make that change.
Thanks, this is exactly the kind of information I need to know.
I probably will wait a couple of months. Doesn't seem like anything else is coming out between now and then though so I wanted to take some time to get a better understanding of what I need.

WRITING.TITLE: TIL Muhammad Ali never publicly admitted losing to Joe Frazier, instead labelling the judges verdict a "White Man's Decision"

WRITING.TEXT:
What the hell, I made an auto level after taking a few days off from this game.
Do Not Move Auto Cannon
D0FC-0000-00A4-F911

I'm late to this post, but here's my story:
A good friend of mine in Mississippi (we're both white) got brain cancer when we were in 10th grade and had to withdraw from school. By senior year she had recovered, and to celebrate her family bought her a new car. It was an exciting day for her to finally be driving since we'd all gotten our licenses and started driving during the couple of years she was sick. But unfortunately her motor skills had not fully returned.
So the night she'd gotten the car she came and picked me up and drove around town picking up another couple of friends and the plan was to get our older friend to buy us booze. He lived right by the highway. Once he was in the car we had to cross the eastbound lanes of the highway to get to the median to then go west, but instead of doing that she turns up the wrong way. We start yelling, "Mary, mary, no. Wrong way." She turns around and gets back to where we were before she started to cross.
Then, she tries again, this time without looking left. There is a car coming fast, probably over 60 mph because its open highway. We slam into its back right door and it spins out and barrel rolls a 100 yards down the road and into the grass median. If she'd pulled out seconds earlier it would have been our left side they slammed in to.
Anyway, we jumped out of the car and ran down to see if they are okay, while calling 911. The car is upside down but they are strapped in and appear alright, and they begin to crawl out themselves. The police and ambulance arrived very quickly.
The men we hit were black and were from out of town, and the cops found weed in their car, so the police arrested them and blamed the whole thing on them. One of them had a broken arm. We were completely stunned.
Fair. It doesn't get too crazy. I like having to pull stunts.
